main_text:
Word meaning has played a somewhat marginal role in early contemporary
philosophy of language, which was primarily concerned with the
structural features of sentence meaning and showed less interest in
the nature of the word-level input to compositional processes.
Nowadays, it is well-established that the study of word meaning is
crucial to the inquiry into the fundamental properties of human
language. This entry provides an overview of the way issues related to
word meaning have been explored in analytic philosophy and a summary
of relevant research on the subject in neighboring scientific domains.
Though the main focus will be on philosophical problems, contributions
from linguistics, psychology, neuroscience and artificial intelligence
will also be considered, since research on word meaning is highly
interdisciplinary.
